defs.docs: A cross-platform Rust API for memory mapped buffers.

attributes.value: / A cross-platform Rust API for memory mapped buffers.

defs.name: MmapOptions
defs.docs: A memory map builder, providing advanced options and flags for specifying memory map behavior.

attributes.value: / A memory map builder, providing advanced options and flags for specifying memory map behavior.
/ `MmapOptions` can be used to create an anonymous memory map using `MmapOptions::map_anon`, or a
/ file-backed memory map using one of `MmapOptions::map`, `MmapOptions::map_mut`,

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Creates a new set of options for configuring and creating a memory map.

attributes.value: / Creates a new set of options for configuring and creating a memory map.
/ // Create a new memory map builder.
/ // Configure the memory map builder using option setters, then create
/ // a memory map using one of `mmap_options.map_anon`, `mmap_options.map`,
/ mmap.copy_from_slice(b"...data to copy to the memory map...");

defs.name: offset
defs.value: pub fn offset(&mut Self, usize) -> &mut Self
defs.docs: Configures the memory map to start at byte `offset` from the beginning of the file.

attributes.value: / Configures the memory map to start at byte `offset` from the beginning of the file.
/ This option has no effect on anonymous memory maps.
/ assert_eq!(&b"A Rust library for cross-platform memory mapped IO."[..],

defs.name: len
defs.value: pub fn len(&mut Self, usize) -> &mut Self
defs.docs: Configures the created memory mapped buffer to be `len` bytes long.

attributes.value: / Configures the created memory mapped buffer to be `len` bytes long.
/ This option is mandatory for anonymous memory maps.
/ For file-backed memory maps, the length will default to the file length.

defs.name: stack
defs.docs: Configures the anonymous memory map to be suitable for a process or thread stack.

attributes.value: / Configures the anonymous memory map to be suitable for a process or thread stack.
/ This option corresponds to the `MAP_STACK` flag on Linux.
/ This option has no effect on file-backed memory maps.

defs.name: map
defs.docs: Creates a read-only memory map backed by a file.

attributes.value: / Creates a read-only memory map backed by a file.
/ This method returns an error when the underlying system call fails, which can happen for a
/ variety of reasons, such as when the file is not open with read permissions.

defs.name: map_exec
defs.docs: Creates a readable and executable memory map backed by a file.

attributes.value: / Creates a readable and executable memory map backed by a file.
/ This method returns an error when the underlying system call fails, which can happen for a
/ variety of reasons, such as when the file is not open with read permissions.

defs.name: map_mut
defs.docs: Creates a writeable memory map backed by a file.

attributes.value: / Creates a writeable memory map backed by a file.
/ This method returns an error when the underlying system call fails, which can happen for a
/ variety of reasons, such as when the file is not open with read and write permissions.
/ let path: PathBuf = /* path to file */

defs.name: map_copy
defs.docs: Creates a copy-on-write memory map backed by a file.

attributes.value: / Creates a copy-on-write memory map backed by a file.
/ Data written to the memory map will not be visible by other processes,
/ and will not be carried through to the underlying file.
/ This method returns an error when the underlying system call fails, which can happen for a
/ variety of reasons, such as when the file is not open with writable permissions.

defs.name: map_anon
defs.docs: Creates an anonymous memory map.

attributes.value: / Note: the memory map length must be configured to be greater than 0 before creating an
/ This method returns an error when the underlying system call fails.

defs.name: Mmap
defs.docs: An immutable memory mapped buffer.

attributes.value: / A `Mmap` may be backed by a file, or it can be anonymous map, backed by volatile memory.
/ Use `MmapOptions` to configure and create a file-backed memory map. To create an immutable
/ anonymous memory map, first create a mutable anonymous memory map using `MmapOptions`, and then

defs.name: map
defs.docs: Creates a read-only memory map backed by a file.

attributes.value: / Creates a read-only memory map backed by a file.
/ This method returns an error when the underlying system call fails, which can happen for a
/ variety of reasons, such as when the file is not open with read permissions.

defs.name: make_mut
defs.docs: Transition the memory map to be writable.

attributes.value: / Transition the memory map to be writable.
/ If the memory map is file-backed, the file must have been opened with write permissions.
/ This method returns an error when the underlying system call fails, which can happen for a
/ variety of reasons, such as when the file is not open with writable permissions.
/ let file = /* file opened with write permissions */

defs.name: MmapMut
defs.docs: A mutable memory mapped buffer.

/ `MmapMut` buffer may be used any place that an in-memory byte buffer is needed. Use

defs.name: map_mut

/ This method returns an error when the underlying system call fails, which can happen for a
/ variety of reasons, such as when the file is not open with read and write permissions.

defs.name: map_anon
defs.docs: Creates an anonymous memory map.

attributes.value: / This method returns an error when the underlying system call fails.

defs.name: flush
defs.docs: Flushes outstanding memory map modifications to disk.

attributes.value: / Flushes outstanding memory map modifications to disk.
/ When this method returns with a non-error result, all outstanding changes to a file-backed
/ memory map are guaranteed to be durably stored. The file's metadata (including last
/ modification timestamp) may not be updated.
/ let path: PathBuf = /* path to file */

defs.name: flush_async
defs.docs: Asynchronously flushes outstanding memory map modifications to disk.

attributes.value: / Asynchronously flushes outstanding memory map modifications to disk.
/ This method initiates flushing modified pages to durable storage, but it will not wait for
/ the operation to complete before returning. The file's metadata (including last
/ modification timestamp) may not be updated.

defs.name: flush_range
defs.value: pub fn flush_range(&Self, usize, usize) -> Result<()>
defs.docs: Flushes outstanding memory map modifications in the range to disk.

attributes.value: / Flushes outstanding memory map modifications in the range to disk.
/ The offset and length must be in the bounds of the memory map.
/ When this method returns with a non-error result, all outstanding changes to a file-backed
/ memory in the range are guaranteed to be durable stored. The file's metadata (including
/ last modification timestamp) may not be updated. It is not guaranteed the only the changes
/ in the specified range are flushed; other outstanding changes to the memory map may be

defs.name: flush_async_range
defs.value: pub fn flush_async_range(&Self, usize, usize) -> Result<()>
defs.docs: Asynchronously flushes outstanding memory map modifications in the range to disk.

attributes.value: / Asynchronously flushes outstanding memory map modifications in the range to disk.
/ The offset and length must be in the bounds of the memory map.
/ This method initiates flushing modified pages to durable storage, but it will not wait for
/ the operation to complete before returning. The file's metadata (including last
/ modification timestamp) may not be updated. It is not guaranteed that the only changes
/ flushed are those in the specified range; other outstanding changes to the memory map may

defs.name: make_read_only
defs.docs: Returns an immutable version of this memory mapped buffer.

attributes.value: / Returns an immutable version of this memory mapped buffer.
/ If the memory map is file-backed, the file must have been opened with read permissions.
/ This method returns an error when the underlying system call fails, which can happen for a
/ variety of reasons, such as when the file has not been opened with read permissions.

defs.name: make_exec
defs.docs: Transition the memory map to be readable and executable.

attributes.value: / Transition the memory map to be readable and executable.
/ If the memory map is file-backed, the file must have been opened with execute permissions.
/ This method returns an error when the underlying system call fails, which can happen for a
/ variety of reasons, such as when the file has not been opened with execute permissions.
